value.title: NVIDIA's AI Supercomputers Get a Massive Upgrade
value.excerpt: The latest version of the A100 now has double the memory of its predecessor, "providing researchers and engineers unprecedented speed and performance to unlock the next wave of AI and scientific breakthroughs.

value.title: Deep Vision announces its low-latency AI processor for the edge

value.title: NVIDIA announces A100 80GB GPU for AI supercomputing
value.excerpt: The latest innovation powering the NVIDIA HGX AI supercomputing platform comes with twice the memory of its predecessor, providing researchers and engineers unprecedented speed and performance to unlock the next wave of AI and scientific breakthroughs.

value.title: NVIDIA built an epic AI supercomputer from four new A100 80GB GPUs
value.excerpt: NVIDIA has revealed its newest workstation, and if you’ve always wanted a gleaming gold obelisk capable of putting petascale power on your desktop, the DGX Station A100 should do the trick.

value.title: NVIDIA Announces Mellanox InfiniBand for Exascale AI Supercomputing
value.excerpt: NVIDIA today introduced the next generation of NVIDIA Mellanox 400G InfiniBand, giving AI developers and scientific researchers the fastest networking performance available to take on the world's most challenging problems.

value.title: NVIDIA DGX Station A100 Offers Researchers AI Data-Center-in-a-Box
value.excerpt: SC20--NVIDIA today announced the NVIDIADGX Station (TM) A100-- the world's only petascale workgroup server. value.title: AMD Goes After NVIDIA With New GPU For The Datacenter
value.excerpt: AMD announced its first data center GPU to compete in high-performance computing (HPC) and Artificial Intelligence (AI). Last year, the company announced that it would bifurcate its GPU technology into two architectures: CDNA for computation and RDNA for graphics.

value.title: FPGA-based inference accelerator outscores GPUs and ASICs in MLPerf benchmark
value.excerpt: Mispology's FPGA-based Zebra AI inference accelerator outperformed Nvidia A100, V100, Tesla T4, AWS Inferencia, Google TPUv3, and others, on the ResNet 50 architecture in ML inference efficiency.

value.title: Nvidia unveils new DGX Station AI workstation, joining market for AI appliances
value.excerpt: The GPU maker uses the annual SC20 supercomputing event to unveil a desktop model of AI computer with a new GPU.

value.title: Nvidia launches A100 80GB GPU for supercomputers

value.title: Apple blamed IBM and Intel for Mac chip delays, but TSMC won’t be next
value.excerpt: Apple's deals with top chipmakers have historically fizzled out, but its relationship with leading chip fabricator TSMC will likely last.

value.title: Amazon begins shifting Alexa’s cloud AI to its own silicon
value.excerpt: On Thursday, an Amazon AWS blog post announced that the company has moved most of the cloud processing for its Alexa personal assistant off of Nvidia GPUs and onto its own Inferentia Application Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC).

value.title: Weather-proof chip aims to take self-driving tech, wireless communications to next level
value.excerpt: A new device can overcome challenges like bad weather to deliver more secure, reliable communications. This could aid military communications in challenging areas, improve the ability of self-driving cars to see the environment around them and speed up wireless data for potential 6G networks.

value.title: Inside the world’s first AI-powered satellite — and its fight against clouds

value.title: Mac Mini with Apple’s new M1 chip will ship for $100 less than the previous model
value.excerpt: Apple announced a bunch of machines powered by its first chip, M1. But there was only one desktop machine announced, a new Mac Mini. The new machine costs just $699  — $100 less than its current Intel-based version with a quad-core CPU.
